page.title: 02Wilson's Dairy Farm.
page.content: The farm has 95 cows,70 produce milk and 25 are dry.Each cow gives up to 10 gallons twice a day totalling 300 gallons a day.The milking parlour takes 10 cows at a time,and milking takes two hours. A fully grown cow eats half a bail of hay and corn every day.Corn costs Â£150 a ton and 1 bail of hay costs Â£1.50. The farm has 140 acres of grassland.80 acres is allowed to grow for silage. After cutting,50 acres are allowed to grow for a 2nd cutting,then 20 acres are allowed to grow for a 3rd cutting. Land not in use for silage is used for grazing.10 acres of land are rented for growing hay. Sale of a calf will bring about Â£100 a cow will bring about Â£500.The farmer gets 14p per pint off the milk marketing board,who sell it at 23p per pint after processing.
